description: manipulate consul acl keys and rules

name.description: the name that should be associated with the acl key, this is opaque to Consul

rules.description: an list of the rules that should be associated with a given token.

token.description: the token key indentifying an ACL rule set. If generated by consul this will be a UUID.

token_type.description: the type of token that should be created, either management or client

state.description: whether the ACL pair should be present or absent

mgmt_token.description: a management token is required to manipulate the acl lists

host.description: host of the consul agent defaults to localhost

scheme.description: the protocol scheme on which the consul agent is running

validate_certs.description: whether to verify the tls certificate of the consul agent

port.description: the port on which the consul agent is running
